content.description: Start from a old tree stump that has been carved into a chair and climb up solid crystals to the first bolt (stick clipping is a good idea with the stump under you). From here, make unique and large moves to the left onto the huge bobble and make your way up the patina to the anchor.
content.protection: 4 or 5 bolts to rap hanger and a ring.
content.location: On the north end of the Tiny Town boulder gets shade most of the day.

content.description: The namesake of the area. A classic well protected lead up solid cobbles to an exciting but well protected slab finish. It is possible to toprope a fun 5.9 directly to the right of this up the steepening slab from the anchors.
content.location: On southwest face of the large boulder that you see in the trees just left of the large field from the parking. Climbs up well-painted hangers starting with a fun mantle to get to a slab then a well cobbled arete.

content.description:
Starting of the large boulder right of the start of

When It Pours It Rains

follow the blunt arete up to meet shared anchors.
content.protection: Established as a TR to be bolted.
content.location: 15' Right of When it pours it rains starting off the large boulder.
